intro: Minuartia umbellulifera var. kurdica, commonly known as the Kurdish rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial species that typically forms dense mats on rocky or gravelly slopes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are characteristic of the Brassicaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. Its morphology and growth habits make it well-suited for rocky habitats and alpine regions.
